character_score_explanation: Both feature adventurous, intelligent protagonists searching for historical artifacts. However, Ben Gates is more cerebral and less action-oriented than Indiana Jones. The supporting characters and villains are less developed in National Treasure compared to Raiders.
plot_score_explanation: Both plots involve a race to find a legendary treasure before villains can obtain it. National Treasure has more puzzle-solving and less action/adventure than Raiders. Both climax with the protagonists witnessing the power of the discovered artifact.
setting_score_explanation: Both feature globe-trotting adventures to historical locations, though National Treasure is set in modern times and focused on American history/locations, while Raiders has a 1930s period setting across multiple countries. Both include ancient tombs/chambers as key settings.
theme_score_explanation: Both explore themes of history, artifacts, and keeping powerful relics out of the wrong hands. However, National Treasure focuses more on American patriotism and puzzles, while Raiders has stronger themes of faith, the supernatural, and good vs. evil.
